{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3703580,"name":null,"username":"aaravsharma23","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/aaravsharma23/{size}/267718_2.png","created_at":"2025-08-06T03:19:54.816Z","cooked":"

Hi guys,

I am using YAGSL to get a swerve drive working. One of the issues is that when I enable the robot, the wheels aren’t aligned, so when i push my left joystick forward, all the drive motors work, but they are unaligned.

moreover, when pushing the left joystick left and right, the motors just keep on spinning slowly at a direction.

I am using thrifty absolute magnetic encoder’s and falcon500 for the motors.

Please let me know if anyone has potential solutions!

This is the link to my github repo with the code:

github.com

GitHub - thethunder206/new_frc

Contribute to thethunder206/new_frc development by creating an account on GitHub.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":45,"updated_at":"2025-08-06T03:28:05.729Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":6,"reads":147,"readers_count":146,"score":59.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":505012,"topic_slug":"yagsl-motors-turning-randomly","display_username":null,"primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.com/thethunder206/new_frc","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"GitHub - thethunder206/new_frc","clicks":5}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":76665,"hidden":false,"trust_level":0,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/yagsl-motors-turning-randomly/505012/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3703643,"name":"Josh P","username":"BigJ","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bigj/{size}/93596_2.png","created_at":"2025-08-06T03:52:19.420Z","cooked":"

Double check that your absolute encoders are wired and set correctly to the intended pods (this could be a wiring OR configuration problem depending on your setup) - if you get them mixed up the problem you describe is a common symptom

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":45,"updated_at":"2025-08-06T03:52:19.420Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":127,"readers_count":126,"score":25.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":505012,"topic_slug":"yagsl-motors-turning-randomly","display_username":"Josh P","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":7632,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/yagsl-motors-turning-randomly/505012/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3703645,"name":"","username":"nstrike","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nstrike/{size}/167038_2.png","created_at":"2025-08-06T03:54:19.052Z","cooked":"

Have you watched any of the YouTube playlist?

Tl;dr It sounds like you haven’t set your offsets correctly. There should be a very detailed explanation of how to do that in the playlist.

If you are 100% sure you did that right then map the way your modules are facing. You may find out that the modules are facing the correct orientation but the modules are set wrong, eg back left module acts like front right, etc.

Docs pages if this isn’t for you.

docs.yagsl.com

Creating your first configuration | YAGSL

docs.yagsl.com

Verifying your Module Locations | YAGSL

Your front may not be what you think it is on a robot.

I made sure the wiring is correct because the encoders are plugged in right. when i open elastic, i see the correct raw absolute encoder values(the same i configured in the json modules). I know this is definitely true since when i looked into the adjusted absolute encoder and when the motors are pointed forward, they fluctuate from 0.5-0.6.

Also, when I look at elastic, it shows that I mapped the modules the correct way since the encoder values for the backleft value change when i move the wheel.

I also correctly added the magnets onto my encoders.

Any other possible issues?

Perfect! As you can see the red lines show that your actual module position and velocity. The blue line shows the module is commanded correctly.

This narrows down your problem significantly!!!

You should up to PID for the angle motors significantly.

This is supposed to be 40

github.com/thethunder206/new_frc

src/main/deploy/swerve/modules/pidfproperties.json

main 

      
    
          
  1. {
    2. 
          
  2.   "drive": {
    3. 
          
  3.     "p": 0.0020645,
    4. 
          
  4.     "i": 0,
    5. 
          
  5.     "d": 0,
    6. 
          
  6.     "f": 0,
    7. 
          
  7.     "iz": 0
    8. 
          
  8.   },
    9. 
          
  9.   "angle": {
    10. 
          
  10.     "p": 1,
    11. 
          
  11.     "i": 0,
    12. 
          
  12.     "d": 0,
    13. 
          
  13.     "f": 0,
    14. 
          
  14.     "iz": 0
    15. 
          
  15.   }
    16. 
          
  16. }
    17.

Changing it now, but when I changed it to 40 last time all of the turn motors spun out of control.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":45,"updated_at":"2025-08-06T05:03:09.711Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":69,"readers_count":68,"score":18.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":505012,"topic_slug":"yagsl-motors-turning-randomly","display_username":null,"primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":51887,"username":"nstrike","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nstrike/{size}/167038_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":76665,"hidden":false,"trust_level":0,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/yagsl-motors-turning-randomly/505012/10","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3703715,"name":"","username":"nstrike","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nstrike/{size}/167038_2.png","created_at":"2025-08-06T05:05:40.710Z","cooked":"

Thats ok! This is why we tune! You just decrease it till it doesn’t oscillate out of control. If that prevents movement then you may want to map movement to ensure that when you rotate the module CCW the angle increases. Its in the docs as CCW+. And referenced in the videos

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":45,"updated_at":"2025-08-06T05:07:08.791Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":10,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":68,"readers_count":67,"score":18.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":505012,"topic_slug":"yagsl-motors-turning-randomly","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":76665,"username":"aaravsharma23","name":null,"avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/aaravsharma23/{size}/267718_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51887,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"YAGSL & YASS Creator "},"post_url":"/t/yagsl-motors-turning-randomly/505012/11","custom_user_title":"YAGSL & YASS Creator ","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3703717,"name":null,"username":"aaravsharma23","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/aaravsharma23/{size}/267718_2.png","created_at":"2025-08-06T05:08:10.429Z","cooked":"

Ok sure, i can try to tune the pid. but what are the other values that i need to tune it, like what does P mean, I mean and D mean? In the video is gives reference to a simulation, but im trying to just get a basic swerve drive working for now.

Also, what do you mean by this " If that prevents movement then you may want to map movement to ensure that when you rotate the module CCW the angle increases. Its in the docs as CCW"

Right now i am decreasing my P value below 20 since it is still oscilating (is this normal for other teams as well)?

The wheels also don’t align when I enable it in DS

The later part doesn’t make sense without the first part so lets focus on that.

You should start by reading through this section starting at this page. A swerve wheel is functionally similar to a turret.

FIRST Robotics Competition Documentation

Introduction to PID

This page explains the conceptual and mathematical workings of a PID controller. A video explanation from WPI is also available. What is a PID Controller?: The PID controller is a common feedback c...

The reason we require it to be CCW+ is so the PID will increase as expected. You could have the encoder value go down with the PID value trying to push it up resulting in a motion seemingly spinning it out of control.

Don’t worry if you dont understand this is fundamental knowledge that is kinda hard to grasp at first. My attempt is in the YAGSL docs and links to wpilib too.

docs.yagsl.com

How to tune PIDF | YAGSL
